poem:
The Last Sane Woman

Aspiring hands shape
clay dreams in quiet rooms,
cups and bowls of disappointment.
Fingers trace the thin line
between craft and chaos.
Nicola, unnamed by fame,
fires her desires in the kiln
of an unforgiving world—
each pot a whisper,
each shard a sigh.
